title: $100.00 USD & 5 Hours Later
body:
MINDOFASOUL1 Today at 06:21
I am providing you with a copy of a recorded chat of me during a game in which my team mates showed no team work, took my advice as being toxic and reported me for not being a part of the run under enemy turret fiesta they had going on. I would like an actual review in which I am a part of on the grounds that 1. I have played for months and months on end with nights of no sleep whatsoever until my eyes felt like they would bleed. 2. I have also contributed and supported RIOT by spending money that I work hard at a dead end job to enjoy the content this game offers. 3. I have invited many friends along the way to join battles and together we have pushed through Bronze, Silver, and Gold divisions to earn a bit of exhilaration for ourselves from actual TOXIC players who join matches simply to be a pest amongst those who want to earn Legendary and Ultimate skins RIOT offers through determined gameplay. 4. Being that I have money from MY pockets invested into this I feel like I deserve an actual review because somehow a decision to PERMANENTLY BAN my account was put into effect without warning, or even a slight chat ban/leaver ban implemented.

Most of these games are filled with 4+ people who honestly don't know much about the characters they choose to play. For RIOT as a company to do these kinds of things is counter-productive to the company and will ultimately be it's downfall with others on the rise. I'm a League fan because it's a fun game. And yeah, I can create a new account and spend more money. But the problem lies in the hours I've already sacrificed to get where I'm at. If I choose to say, "Hey, you shouldn't feed. It helps the enemy team." I'm called out as toxic. Which is totally unfair. If my team mate, or opponent, says "Fuck you, I do what I want." But is not viewed as toxic behavior it leaves fans like myself questioning the legitimacy and integrity of RIOT and it's employees. This game has been and always will be promoted as a TEAM game. If one person on the TEAM decides that his or her team mates are not as serious or determined to reach specific milestones how can you decide without any notice that they should ultimately be banned? How can I take, "LOL He's TOXIC! OMG THE SALT. MAD CUZ BAD. YOU SUCK" as serious forms of wanted help? I never said in these matches I'm the greatest player if you don't listen to me you will always suck. All I said was, "Okay, well since you don't want to take my advice, screw it, I'll go play around in the Jungle and farm minions." What other choice do I have? Continuously die over and over and over?

Not to mention that this permanently banned notice popped up on my screen less than 24 hours from me spending another $100.00 USD on 15000 RP. Less than 24 hours of me sending RIOT a piece of my share that I work hard for, they're sending me a notice about permanently banning my account because I ended up on a team full of either kids who didn't know how to play, or did, and just wanted to be jerks, roaming around, getting no CS, cursing at each other about how it's their first time playing PvP or certain champs. I play on the NA server from Florida and am pretty sure there's a couple thousand of people within that zone. It happens. People get frustrated. But I want to know in what way was I toxic for dismissing them and muting them?

Mind you, the entire time, Vayne is cursing at me and so was the other players on the enemy team who ultimately trolled after realizing their Varus was 7/1 and Jax had yet to die within 20 minutes of gameplay, doing things like roaming each other's lanes and inputting laugh taunts at me and my team-mates because of the Fortune/Vayne bot lane duo on our team. (Not to sound "salty" but why have the emotions input into these characters if using them could be just as easily interpretted as "toxic behavior?")

All in all, I'd like an actual review and feel like I as a player and spender deserve one. I am being ousted as a toxic player and ultimately robbed by your company without a bit of honesty given light to the situation in which I seem to be permanently banned for.

And I am a working man, I spent $120.00 in the past two weeks to boost to level 30 and I haven't gotten any word about bans or anything. Even before then. I stopped playing for a few months as I worked and saved my money up. I can't recall any bans placed on me for anything. Not a 8 game chat ban, 14 game chat ban, 14 day suspension on my account, or anything!

The terms of use and the summoner's code define what toxicity is pretty clearly.

Instant permanent bans are very, very rare. If you think that happened to you and it was undeserved you can always submit a support ticket. What is far more common is people ignore the reform cards they get until it's too late.

Like I said, the moral of this story is don't spend money on stuff if you don't fully understand or haven't read the terms of use or the contract you agreed to.
